cluster_relations.rel_desc: Welds of austenitic stainless steels may exhibit a duplex-type (austenitic-ferritic) structure, linking them conceptually to duplex stainless steels.

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: in welds of 300 Series stainless steels
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: MicrostructureContext: weld metal/heat-affected zone duplex (austenitic-ferritic) structure

remarks: Relation created mainly to capture that welds of austenitic stainless steels can show a duplex (austenitic-ferritic) microstructure; semantic mapping to the duplex stainless steel family is approximate.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stainless steels contain varying amounts of chromium as an alloying element.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: CompositionContext: alloy content in stainless steels

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that two material classes are conceptually related because they can exhibit similar or analogous microstructural features under certain conditions.
args.justification: The relation describes that welds of austenitic stainless steels may show a duplex (austenitic-ferritic) structure, conceptually linking them to duplex stainless steels. This is not strict equivalence or hierarchy but a similarity in microstructural behavior. A predicate explicitly capturing microstructural similarity is most appropriate.
args.remark: This captures an approximate, condition-dependent similarity in microstructure rather than a strict classification link.

args.justification: The connection is based on similarity of duplex-type (austenitic-ferritic) microstructure between austenitic stainless steel welds and duplex stainless steels, fitting a class focused on microstructural similarity between materials.

The relation is fundamentally about microstructural characteristics (austenitic-ferritic duplex structure), which falls under a structural/microstructural dimension rather than composition, causality, or hierarchy.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an alloy or material contains a given chemical element as part of its intentional alloy composition.
args.justification: The instance describes stainless steels containing chromium as an alloying element. The existing raw relation_name already closely matches the intended semantics, so it is appropriate to normalize and adopt it as the canonical predicate for composition via alloying elements.
This relation connects an alloy class (stainless steel) to a specific alloying element (chromium), which is a canonical example of an alloying-element-based composition relation.
The relation is explicitly about which element is present in the material's composition and in what varying amounts, fitting the COMPOSITION dimension.
